citeinfo.origin: FAO, ISME, ITTO, UNESCO-MAB, UNEP-WCMC and UNU-INWEH
citeinfo.title: AmericanSamoa

descript.abstract:
This dataset has been created as part of a collaboration between FAO, ISME, ITTO, UNESCO-MAB, UNEP-WCMC and UNU-INWEH to revise the 1997 World Alas of Mangroves. The aim to further promote the conservation, restoration and sustainable use of Mangrove ecosystems and produce a revised Global Atlas.
Further details about the project and the partners can be found at:
http://www.fao.org/forestry/foris/webview/forestry2/index.jsp?siteId=5321&langId=1
descript.purpose: Mangroves are of great environmental and economic importance. They contribute a rich genetic diversity, provide homes for a wide variety of species and act as a buffer zone between terrestrial and marine ecosystems. They also provide valuable goods and services for many local communities. However, mangrove ecosystems have also been severely damaged by human activities including urban development; agriculture; development of shrimp aquaculture; and influxes of pollutants. Drastic loss of mangrove forests has been observed in tropical and sub-tropical countries all over the world. As close ecological connections exist between the three major tropical coastal ecosystems - coral reef, seagrass and mangrove ecosystems - the conservation of mangroves is essential for the survival of these coral reefs and seagrass.
descript.supplinf:
When displaying the data it is important to select those polygons where vegn = 111 to display mangrove.
vegn = 111 Mangrove vegn = 900 Non-Mangrove
Source_id . Links mangrove polygons to source table.

idinfo.accconst: This dataset is not currently available for release. However, the 1997 version may be obtained under data licence from UNEP-WCMC.
idinfo.useconst: Contact the information office at UNEP-WCMC for terms and conditions of licence agreement. 1 - acknowledge the source appropriately 2 - will not distribute the data in its original form - this is to ensure that current data is being used. 3. - provide up to two copies of any publication that uses the data 4. - the data is made available to for strictly non-commercial use
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000
idinfo.datacred: FAO, ISME, ITTO, UNESCO-MAB, UNEP-WCMC and UNU-INWEH.

attracc.attraccr: Attribute accurace has been verified by ensuring that all polygons have a vegn attribute of either 111 (for mangrove) or 999 ( for non mangrove). Visual comparisons with original source material through hard copy print outs was undertaken after the digitization/incorporation of every source, before incorporation into the global mangrove layer. All data must have an ISO3 country code. The attribute information is being restructured to incorporate species level information and direct linkage to the UNEP-WCMC species database.

dataqual.logic: All polygons must have a label point containing a VEGN code and and ISO3 country code. No node-dangles are permitted in the dataset. No duplicate features or overlapping polygons allowed.
dataqual.complete: This dataset is currently in the process of being updated.

pubinfo.publish: The International Society for Mangrove Ecosystems (ISME)

srcinfo.srccontr: This dataset has been compiled from a wide range of sources. Individual source informatiuon is directly linked to each polygon.

procstep.procdesc:
Present: Data collection is currently being coordinated by FAO and ISME. Data processing and integration of new data is being carried out by UNEP-WCMC. Further information to be added shortly.
Past: Mangrove data were mainly hand digitized at UNEP-WCMC from paper map sources. The data come form a wide range of sources at a wide range of scales. The nominal resolution of the global dataset is therefore around 1: 1000000. After digitization the data were manually edited to eliminate node-dangle errors and duplicate or sliver polygons. Data were matched to the MundoCart digital coastline database, except in cases were matching would cause serios loss of detail and degrade the data. The data were cleaned and build using the smallest tollerances. The data were manually labelled and checked for labelerrors. Data which came in digital form were treated in the same manner as hand digitized maps for quality control.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

edom.edomvd: Area of non-mangrove within a mangrove area

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
